text: Tap Dark ruby colour with small head.Aroma is roasted and fruity with taste of dark dried fruits and toffee caramel and even nuts nice malty and sweet finish with medium body.
Roodbruin bier met weinig wit schuim. Geur: moutzoetig, melkchocolade, kandij. Smaak: moutzoetig, pruimen, kandij, warm alcoholisch. Sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Medium volmondig.

Bottle at Bierhuis Rotterdam, Helsinki. Pours nearly black with a medium-sized white head. The aroma features wheaty maltiness with raisin and vanilla. Taste is medium to heavily sweet, drying and becoming slightly bitter towards finish. Sweet, wheaty maltiness and yeast are prominent: flavours of plum, raisin and caramel. The palate is medium to full bodied, velvety smooth and low in carbonation. Rich and potent. Definitely a Dutch take on this style; displays quadrupel-like qualities more than those that are characteristic to German weizenbocks.

Bottle, deep dark brown, near black, with a heavy body and a fast settling tan head. Nose has dried dark fruit and a little treacle, palate is rich and warming with complex flavours of roast malt and fruit. A soft texture is reminiscent of milk stout, with the roastiness and light burnt bitterness evening out the sweet fruit. Delicious.
At Home black colored body with a off white head and a roasted caramel malt hops aroma a roasted malt hops bitter sweet caramel taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Bottle 0.33l from Albert Heijn supermarket Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 18.01.2017. Pour it dark color with small white head. Aroma roasted malt, chocolate. Taste sweet caramel, roasted malt, licorice, little bit metallic note on the back, finish with alcohol chocolate feel, medium sweetness, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish.

Heel donker bruin.....bijna zwart van kleur, weinig koolzuur, laagje crèmekleurig schuimkraag. 
Aroma: Geroosterde tarwemout, karamel, gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, koffie, Chocolade en enigzins zoetig.
Smaak: Zoete karamel, bruine suiker, donker gedroogd fruit, moutig en vol ...donker brood, melk chocolade en een volle roasted koffie smaak. Een warme subtiele alcohol hint.....Zeer prettig. De bitter is licht en ergens zit er ook wel een zuurtje in.... kers of zoiets, geeft net even een punch.
Smaakvol spul!
Body is vol, weinig koolzuur, mondgevoel is romig en zacht, afdronk is roasty en zoetig....iets alcohol en iets droog.

Pours brown/ruby red with medium head. Aroma: bread, molasses, malt. Taste: nice thick bock with a clear bready profile coupled with molasses and malt sweetness. Tastes like a solid German traditional doppelbock. Good.

Das Jopen Johannieter ist ein Weizen Doppelbock. Es ist schwarz, blickdicht mit einer beigen Schaumkrone. Es duftet angenehm r?stmalzig mit Aromen von Schokolade und getrockneten Fr?chten. Der Geschmack ist leicht s??. Wieder zeigt sich Schokolade und Trockenfr?chte, aber auch Karamell und etwas Lakritz im Abgang. Dazu eine leichte Bittere. Die 9% sind gef?hrlich gut versteckt. 
Erneut ein Jopen-Bier, welches ich gerne weiter empfehle.
Bottle from supermarket in Amsterdam. Dark brown. Nose is lots of malts, sweet and toasted, light coffee, vanilla. Tastes lots of sweet and toasted malts, vanilla, caramel, dried fruits.

Pitch black, big offish white head, nicely persistent.
Smell is pungent cheese yoghurt bitterness, pure chocolate, puke, metal and blood. Liquorice.
Taste is bitter watery. Milk chocolate, quite crisp. Hint of caramel and toffee. Tobacco, hint of leather. Interesting, but the tastes dont balance out very well.

33 cL bottle at home. Pretty sure Ive had this before but apparently never rated it. Pours dark brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma is malty with some caramel, dark fruits and sweetness. Taste is quite sweet with some dark fruits, caramel, bit of licorice, some roast, medium bitter. Medium body and carbo.

This is a dark and strong beer without beiing very sweet or heavy. Full round taste. Subtile tones of dark chocolate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Donkerbruin bier met dikke compacte mokkakleurige schuimkraag die langzaamaan wegebt. Aroma van geroosterd, mout, chocolade. Smaken van mout, kruidig, vleugje kaneel. Lekker bier, niks mis mee. Maar bokbieren zal nooit mijn favoriete soort worden.

33 cl bottle, served in snifter glass. Poured dark brown, almost black with a three finger tan head. Aroma: Overripe banana, chocolate, dark roasted malts, bread, caramel. Taste: overripe banana, milk chocolate, licorice, raisins, dates, hazelnuts, whole wheat bread, toffee, vanilla, roasted espresso beans, fudge. Very thick, creamy mouthfeel. Low carbonation. Leaning towards stout territory and really tastes like a weird combo of a banana/chocolate milkshake. Full body with a creamy roasted banana/chocolate finish. This is one sweet & delicious brew! Love it!

33cl bottle, poured into a snifter on 7-Oct-2016. Dark brown with a medium sized beige coloured head which dissipates over time. Aroma of sweet toffee, cocoa, pine and alcohol. Full body and medium carbonation. Flavour of chocolate malt, liquorice and tobacco. Light sweetness and lots of roasted malt. A dubblebock, but does have some of the character of a stout. Pretty damn good.

Pours nut brown with small beige head. Aroma is malts, caramel, some banana, sweet fruits, some toasted bread, light chocolate, cinnamon. Taste is malty, sweet, bitter, caramel, cream, cinnamon, apple pie, light sweetness. Nice beer!
Bottle at home. Dark brown pour with a tan head. Notes of tosted caramel, dried fruit, overripe bananas, chocolate, raisins, milk coffee. Medium body, soft carbonation and a sweet finish.
bottle at wvrst. good to the style. beautiful roast with a whiff of smoke. bit of head.brown colour.swwet-ish.

Tap. Pours very dark reddish brown with beige head. Aroma has dark and roasted malts with caramel and slight notes of liquorice. Taste is roasted malty with dark caramel and some overripe fruits and a note of liquorice. Finish is semi-sweet and malty and slightly dry for the style.

Draft. Creamy medium tan head atop cola dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, bread, some cherry, milk chocolate, alcohol warming, spicy. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some cherry, bread, alcohol warming, milk chocolate. Medium body, some stickiness.
Yep, very good beer. Dark, No Head. Strong, sweet and roasted, but mild. Good mouthfeel, aftertaste and overall impression

The beer looks great. The color of the beer is dark brown on the eye. With a really strong light behind it, a reddish glow is unveiled. The beer has quite some cloudiness. No surprise, because the beer is unfiltered. On top of the beer, a nice layer of rather rough almond colored foam is formed. The bulk of the foam collapses, leaving almost nothing behind. The smell is a bit disappointing. For a top 50 beer, Ive had expected a bit more. The smell is a bit to mild. There are some nice aromas of sweet chocolate and roasted malts. There is also a little sour aroma, of dark Forrest fruits. There is also a creamy touch. The more songs you take, the better the smell gets. After a while, the smell is quite nice. The beer just needs some time to come to live. It shouldnt be served to cold. The taste of the beer is nice, but not the best in the world. There are flavors of chocolate, red forrest fruits, toast, roasted grains, licorice, almonds and alcohol. Its just like the flavors most bok beers have. It isnt bad, the contrary. Its just that my expectations where a tiny bit higher. The finish is a bit watery and had a touch of metal. There is also a nice amount of almonds in the finish. All in all, not s bad beer, but top 50?Earlier Rating: 3/10/2016 Total Score: 4.1The beer is tapped to perfection. A thick layer of almond colored creamy foam covers the beer. The beer itself is pitch black on the eye and only with a strong wintery beam of sunlight a brown color is revealed. Man, is this beer dark. The smell is very nice. It has a nice little wild yeas touch to it, which is a little sour. There is also a strong bittersweet licorice smell and the bitternes of a tiny bit of roasted barley. The smell has a good balance between sweetness, bitterness and a little sourness. The taste is very good as well. It has the same little roasted barley and licorice touch to it. The beer has a nice strong bitterness, balanced out by a nice sweetness and a little sour touch. The finish is very nice and, bitter and has something savory. The beer has a nice palate, with very much small bubbles with a little sting to it. Very good.

Bottled. Color is black beer with red hue and thick dark brown head. Aroma is roasted,bread, wheat, and dark chocolate. The flavor is sweeter ending very dry. A bit thin bodied for its weight. It is a mix of stout and Weizen rather than a weizenbock.

A pitch black beer with a well lasting brown head. Nose has loads of ripe bananas, spices and chokolate. Taste is quite sweet and roasty with a slowly appearing bitter finish. Soft carbonation and rich palate. This is very nice and drinkable. I like the spicy banana cake aroma.
Tap@ taphouse. Small fizzy beige head. Very dark mahogany color. Aroma of bread, malt, dark fruit, hint of citrus. Medium body. Moderated sweet favour. Light lingering malty sweet finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Very dark brown almost black with a big beige head. Aroma and taste is very sweet bready malty, with notes of caramel, toffee, light cocoa, some nice spices into the finish. Lovely.

(Draught at Jopen Proeflokaal, Amsterdam, 20 Feb 2016. Vintage 2013) Black colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with dried fruit, chocolate and toasted wheat. Malty, roasted taste with notes of chocolate, dark bread, caramel, banana and flavours of wheat. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness and a gentle bitterness. Well balanced and warming weizenbock. Nice one.

Mild süffig mit einer leicht süßen Seele, angenehmer Perlung und einer erstaunlicher Fruchtigkeit and Beeren angelegt. Zudem leicht in Schoko und Vanille neben einer klassischen Getreidigkeit. Gute Sache das.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, spice, hops, chocolate, bread and bitterness.

Bottle bought at the Netherlands. The beer has got a deep dark brown colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of yeast and wheat. Taste of yeast, wheat, dark bread, caramel and malt. Dusty-malty finish.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted bread, wheat, and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted bread, wheat, and dark chocolate, leading to dry wheaty finish.

Aroma:

Moderate malty, roasted, caramel, coffee, slight chocolate, dark fruits, raisin.

Appearance:

Dark brown/red beer with an average lasting, creamy head.

Taste/Palate:

Heavy sweet and moderate bitter, malty, chocolate, coffee, roasted dark fruits, touch of wheat, hop bitter ending.

Geproefd in de jopenkerk. Heerlijk spul, mooi zwart bier met een zacht tintje rook. Lekker vol

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a slightly roasted wheat malty spicy caramel aroma with weak smoky hints. Fruity wheat malty spicy caramel flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy caramel finish.
Roasted bitterness, sweet bock backbone and smooth cocoa finish. Nice stuff. Backlog from 2014/10/11.

28-11-2015-0,33l Flasche/Ende Bocktasting/Schwarz-brauner Körper mit beigem Schaum.Aroma Laritz, dunkle Schokolade,Trockenpflaume.Antrunk Karamell, röstig ölige Textur. Gute eigenwillige Interpretation eines Weizendoppelbocks.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours black with a small tan head and an aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee, toffee, dried plums, ripe fruits, alcohol and some smokiness. The taste is medium sweet, with some booziness and some hoppy bitterness in the finish.

0.33 l bottle from local AH, bottled in August 2015. Slightly hazy, dark red with a huge, slowly diminishing, frothy, tan to brown head. Faint, sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, nuts, caramel and some coffee. Sweetish-malty taste of nuts, caramel, raisins and coffee, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter and a bit boozy finish. Medium to full body, creamy and effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. A bit one-dimensional but at least with a nice finish. Expected more!

Recommended by a friend. Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with beige head. Aroma: heavy malt, coffee, chocolate, banana, pear. Taste: Sweet with medium bitterness. Smoky flavor with notes of coffee and red fruits. Quite boozy.Texture is oily. Carbonation is lively.

[9/23/15] Draught at Jopen Proeflokaal in Amsterdam. 2014 version. Dark brown to black with a beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, nuts. Sweet flavor with caramel, chocolate, nuts, some fruitiness. Medium-bodied.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 Dit haast zwarte bok heeft een duidelijke moutgeur. Het schuim trekt snel weg. De smaak is die van pure chocolade, koffie en karamel. Dit in een prima balans. Mooi bier.

Delft 10-10-2015

Wow! Wat een lekker stout achtig bier. Perfecte chocolade smaak met kleine hint naar koffie/caramel. Lekkere zoete smaak maar tegelijkertijd ook stevig en veel inhoud. Echt top!

33cl bottle at home. pours a hazy dark brown colour with a decent off-white head which depletes fairly fast. Aromas of chocolate, licorice, coffee. taste is yeasty sweetness with notes of licorice, roasted nuts, banana, coffee. tectuxe is creamy. soft carbonation.

Unclear why this is under weizenbocks but it does not realy matter. It is deep murky dark with soft prickly carbonation. Heavy, slightly sour, sirrupy and a bit sweet with an oily texture. Flavor is nicely complex roasted malts, overripe fruit, chestnuts, caramel and bitter hops. Strong but not boozy and dangerously easy to drink. Quite delicious.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 09/09/16, at Hell Hunt, 20150927) The beer poured clear and deep dark brown. Aroma had toasted malts, sweetness and herbalness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, toasted malts, ash, caramel and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet, roasty and bitter. A brew that was very sweet and also roasty and had nothing that would make me consider this beer as a weizenbock. Still not bad.
chocolate, resin, earthy, cough drop, licorice, brown/black, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter finish, one to remember.

Bottle from saveur-biere: Dark brown color, creamy brownish head. Aroma is wheaty with intensive roasted malt and dark fruits notes. Flavor is also wheaty with slightly banana and intensive plum notes, cloves, alcohol, roasted malt. Tasty.
Tap @ Café Onder de Ooievaar, Amsterdam. Pours dark brown with a large, beige head. Aroma is roast, butter, dark fruit, dark caramel. Taste is some butter, some dark caramel. Not my thing.

The beer is round and smooth. Nice sweetish Weizen aroma, round but not too intense. Sweetish-mild, hints of grain, not too much depth, sweetish yeasty with nice caramel in the aftertaste. Interesting with no bitterness.

APPEARANCE: black beer, small stable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, chocolate.
TASTE: coffee, chocolate, mocha.

Bottle, pours ruby/brown with a beige head. Aroma: leather, nutmeg, nuts, sugar. Taste: bread, leather, spices, light roast and smoke, nuts, figs, bit of liquorice. Light-medium sweet, moderate bitter, creamy texture, soft carbonation, slightly sour, somewhat bitter finish. Indeed a hybrid, very nice!
Really dark and malty. Mildly sour and milky taste. Smooth texture with a big and bubbly head.

Aroma of banana, cappucino, bread and alcohol. Nice dark colour with a big light brown head. Nice creamy texture. Flavours are a bit sour, nutty (roasted), peaches, banana, bread a little bit of cafe latte and a sour little bit dry roasted, nutty aftertaste. Great for a weizen bock

Bottle 0,33 @ Gambrinus. Shared with froends.
Dark color. Rich aroma, mostly roasted malt, smoked. Taste like stout. Nice bittterness and sweetness combination. Liked it a lot.

Bottle. Dark brown body, medium to small head. Aroma has estery licorice with vinous notes. Smooth roasty taste with ashy notes. Low sweetness but the roastiness is not very sharp either. Nice balance. I have never had a wheat beer that was so highly roasted. Finish is just a bit muddy. Interesting crossover beer, its not easy to classify this.

creamy beige head leaves lacing. dark brown colour. aroma is caramel, roasted malts, chocolate, quad esters, bit of leather. taste like aroma, malty ends with a nice bitter bite. rather dense body, medium carbonation. delicious bock, great sweet-bitter balance. bottle 33cl / bbf aug-2015

330ml bottle. Murky dark brown color. Medium size, brown-beige head, stays.Roast, alcohol, black pepper, dead grass in aroma. Sourish, malty, grainy, smoky, peat in taste. Full body. Nice texture. Long lasting smoky aftertaste.
Keg at cafe de spuyt. Pours dark brown, sweet, chocolate roast, light liquorice.

Bottle at The Fiddler. Pours dark brown with ruby highlights and a large, frothy beige head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is toast, chocolate, and nutty malt with earthy hops, prunes and figs. Flavor is sweet dark malt, dark fruits, light hops and bitterness with peppery alcohol and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

0,33L bottle (from Drink Shop, Tallinn). Pours dark copper-amber with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is malt, caramel, grass, some smoke. Flavor is sweet, caramel, wheat, smoke, some metallic notes. Overall: very good.

Had 2 versions:
Best before end 2014
Dark beer with a malty aroma, some caramel. taste is malty, some liquorice quite sweet. aged good.

Best before end 2016
Dark beer with malty aroma, some caramel. Taste is malt, bitter sweet. good

Brown beer, tan head. Nose is wheat, plum notes, malt, roast, caramel. Flavor is wheat, alcohol, sweetness, roast, fruity notes, lots of sweetness, chocolate. Finishes with a whiff of booze and some chocolate sweetness. A weird one, but hides the alcohol well. If youre into sweet beers, this is a nice one. Thanks to martjoobolut for sharing!

330ml bottle (Koht, Tallinn)
Sweet, slightly sticky, aroma, touch of treacle hinted at. Very deep red, small persistent tight tan head. Full, but soft and smooth in the palate, very mellow and comforting. Served at a great temperature - no chill to this at all, helps keep it mellow. Taste is a weird one - its all over the place, different with every sip. First some candifloss, then a more typical belgian strong dark ale, then some stouty roastiness, then some almond. This truly defies style bounds, without having to be imperial, or include dog bollocks. All the while, the taste of the alcohol is well hidden. Theres a nice warming aspect to the feel after swallowing, puts a smile on you face and makes you feel welcome on an icy winter night. Later finish, in particuler after the stouter aspects have come through in the taste, is quite biningly bitter - a very nice little bite, and a metallic tingle to the teeth on the touch of the tongue - nice. Again, a very decent beer from Jopen.
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark brown with a low off-white head. Aroma is slightly roasted sweet malts. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel and some alcohol. Good.
On tap at cafe Briljant. Dark with an offwhite head. Aroma of roasted malts, hint of chocolate. Taste is sweet, roasted malts, chocolate. Nice.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2016 33cl via Jan Linders, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 9%
Uitgeschonken in La Trappe glas

Uiterlijk: donkerbruin met schuimkraag die snel wegtrekt

Aroma en smaak: koffie, gebrande mouten, chocolade, caramel

Conclusie: richting stout, lekker hoor
0,33l bottle. Great beer! full of flavour, strong taste. This is one of the better Dutch beers around

Large frothy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Body is flat black.
Aroma contains lots of roasted and toasted malts with nuts, choclolate and coffee. Also citrus fruits and sweet fruits like grape and raisin, brown sugar, vanilla, licorice, cola and hints of smoke.
Flavor is light acidic, then light sweet and light acidic, followed by sweet, sweet and bitter and finishing in bitter (like espresso)
Body is medium to full with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Great beer for a cold winter evening.

Drinking from tab at BBF Amsterdam.
In the aroma alcohol, roast malt, coffee.
The unclear black beer has a small brown head.
In the taste grains and caramel.
Low carbonated.

Bottle. Pours murky brown in color with a tan head. Sweetness, dark and slightly roasted malty notes, sweet chocolate and hints of dried fruits in aroma. Theres some earthy beneath all this as well. Nuttyness and chocolate in taste, bit of sweet maltyness and hints of yeasty spicyness appears later on. Butterscotch and chocolatey coffee in aftertaste. Good and warming brew for the colder season

A bock they say; a stout they say. More of a stout IMHO, but that?s ok! A dark brown beer, tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee. Taste, sweet dark fruits at first, honey, finishes bitter. Oily, sticky, but not too much. Nice!

Dark brown beer with a beige head.
Smells like caramel.
Taste is roasted malt, caramel, smoke, and coffee.
Nice bitter / sweet afthertaste.
Deliciuos double bock / Stout beer.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2015 Aroma of malt, coffee, dark fruits, chocolate, dark bread, some liquorice. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long coffee bitter finish. As advertised, its like a marriage between Doppelbock and Stout. My kind of Bock.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruit, berries, chocolate and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown/black beer with medium yeast and with a slight/medium beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dark fruit, berries and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Always love when the brewer dares to add roasted malts to such a beer. Would say it is more of a Doppelbock than a Weizen Bock.

Bottle 33cl. Opaque dark brown, large frothy tan head, good retention, recedes slowly to a thick layer, good lacing too; roasted malts nose, bitter chocolate, coffee, dried dark fruits, bit woody; taste moderate sweetbitter, roasty; full-bodied, oily texture, average carbonation; light roasted dry bitter finish, fruity notes, bit alcohol. Quite good.

Es una cerveza de color marrón oscuro con una cabeza de color blanquecino.
Sabores de chocolate, pasas, maltas tostadas, ciruelas, alcohol y un final dulce y pegajoso. Buena cerveza.

Bottle. Dark brown with big beige head. Lots of roasted malts, coffee, Christmas cake, dried plums and a nice fresh fruity finish. Quite sweet but not dominant, nice light roasted bitter finish. Full bodied. Lovely.

Donkerbruin, bijna zwart bier met cremekleurige schuimkraag. Geuren van mout, chocola, gedroogd fruit, bitterzoet van smaak met tonen van chocola, gedroogd fruit, rozijnen, koffie en gebrand mout. Complex van smaak dus. Nasmaak is bitter met een zoete ondertoon. Lekkere bok!

Bottle 33cl. Deep brown, almost black with a light brown head thats firm. Aroma has hints of coffee and roasted malts. The taste is heavy, with the typical bitterness of Jopen especially in the aftertaste.
Even een afzakkertje na de ouderavond...Heerlijk zwaar bockbier, met licht bittertje in de afdronk.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Dark brown colour, beige nicely lacing head. Aroma and taste are big on liquorice, burnt malts and alcohol, a little (red) fruity, some dark chocolate, clove. Aftertaste lingers nicely. Really oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation, good body. (3.8)
24/10/16: very well balanced roasted malty chocolate, caramel, cacao, dried fruits, clove, bread, weizen banana.

(Drinking date: 11 July 2014) Pitchblack beer with a beige frothy head of foam. Bit of a metal aroma, but also nice burned aromas. Also a bit salted liqorice aroma, and aromas of ripe dark fruits. The taste is really good. Bitterness of the burned malts, and a bit of a liqorice taste. The mouthfeel is also good. Slightly thicker/smoother body with medium carbonation. Overall, this is a really good beer. Strong beer with good burned aroma and flavour, and a slightly thick body. I like this! Total score 3.9!

30cl bottle @ home from Melgers, Haarlem. Dark brown-ruby color, outstanding rocky borwnish head with good lacing. Aroma roasted malt, caramel, moderated chocolate and coffee, licorice, hint of dried fruits. Alcohol is slightly noticable already in the nose. Taste medium sweetness, medium to heavy bitterness. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, coffeeish bitter-sweet finish with medium duration. Deliciuos dessert beer.

An improved version of the normal bock beer they brew. Where the normal bock is a little bland, this one gives you a kick in the head with all the diverent tastes it contains. It has the look of a bock beer, dark brown with an off white head and a medium carbonation. Earthy character with dark fruits, grains, liqourice and caramel. and underneath it all the typical Jopen taste peeks trough. A pretty nice beer.

33cl bottle from Marqt. Aromas of raisins, dark grapes, musty and earthy accents. Not too find of the aroma. Tastes of chocolate, raisins, roasted malts, plum, alcohol, has a medium body and a sweet, sticky finish. According to the label it isn't sweet, but it kind of is :) Not unique, but a good bockbier.

Small bottle kindly preserved by the RBHD tasting party on Fridtjoffen. Pours a clear mahogany colored body with a short lived light brown rim. Malty, vinuous nose with notes of liquiorice. Similar in the mouth. A nice full bodied malty beer with a suiting alco warmth.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours dark amber with a tiny white head. Aroma of dark malts, raisins and plums.Taste is moderate sweet, caramel and dark malts, raisins and some port. Lingering and moreish.
Dark brown, beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, toffee, roasted malt and dark berries. Similar taste, but with much more chocolate. Heavy chocolate spread in aftertaste.

Shared bottle at local tasting, from Voldby Købmandsgaard. ABV is 9%. Dark brown colour, rich beige head. Moderate but nice aroma, malty with hints of dark bread and banana. Pleasant flavour of chocolate and banana, smooth and very drinkable. Low bitterness. Will buy again.

Fra flaskepå RBHD-treff ombord på Fridtjofen mai-14: kveldens første mørke aroma (det har gått mye i lyse, alkoholsvake øl - tro det eller ei!). Sviskeplommer og kvalitetssjokolade. Smaksrik, fyldig med mørke bær og samtidig lettdrikkelig. Kveldens beste.
Pours brown color with medium tan head. Alcohol and malt on the nose. Medium sweet taste.

bruin met licht bruine kraag. aroma is redelijk aards, muf, donker fruit, en moutig. 
smaken zijn redelijk zoet van bruine suiker, matig biter, sterk, donkere fruiten en iets van rozijnen, pruim en wat geroosterde mouten.
medium body, romig en glad van textuur, lage co2. afdronk kruidig en zoetig.
redelijk maar niet zo bijzonder.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes orangebraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv hefig fruchtig, Geschmack sehr hefig, fruchtig, bananig, leicht röstmalzig, leicht alkoholisch.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2014 Medium to large brown head, black brown dark colour some red glow, hay sweet, minty dark chocolat warm smell, medium carbonation and medium to high bitter creamy a bit ice cream like chocolat bitter a bit like a stout
Dark brown colour, some beige foam. Sweet and malty character. Aroma of caramel and roasted malt. Light bitter roasty finish. Good, nothing special.

Een lekker gebrand bokje zonder de veelvuldig voorkomende te zoete smaak. Terechte voormalige winnaar van de bokprijs.
Wel buigevoelige smaak.
a nice fruity malty smell pours a dark creamy chocolate, then tastes of thick creamy sour cherry chocolate, nice cherry moreish after taste beautiful!

29/XI/13 - 33cl bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home - BB: 21/VIII/14 (2013-1103) 
Clear purple brown beer, aery to creamy beige head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of chocolate, caramel, bit of vanilla, some overripe banana. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: chocolate, ripe banana, caramel, little bitter, mocha, sweet, some vanilla. Aftertaste: bitter hops, banana, toast, mocha, caramel, bitter ending, hoppy.

Draught at Cafe De La Gare, The Hague. Pours dark brown with a lacy brown head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, yeast, herbal and some toffee. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Tap at Cafe De La Gare, Den Haag. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin light tan head. The aroma is yeasty malt and a little fruit. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a yeast alcohol bitter palate. Nice to drink but very similar to many other beers.
Heel donkerbruin en een plakkerige kraag. Aroma van koffieijs, caramel, cacaomelk. Smaakt cremig , mokkakoffielikeur, donkere mout. mocht wat mij betreft wat voller van smaak zijn..
33cl bottle. Dark brown with a medium off-white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with bitter notes. Raisin, caramel, coffee, malts and licorice. Great bockbeer.

Bottled from biernavigatie.nl. Dark brown colored, lasting brown head. Malty nose, some rye, iron, licorice (Dutch: salmiak). Sweet malty flavor, rye and licorice again, some bitterness. Thick mouthfeel. More bitter and somewhat alcoholic in finish. Im not overly impressed, probably because i dont really enjoy licorice in beer in general, but somehow i easily finished the bottle.

Fresh, neutral smell. Looks great, nice and dark with a small head. The smell is pretty neutral, a little sweet. Hints of licorice. Feels good in the mouth, soft and nice amount of carbonation. However, the taste does not evolve, nothing too complex. Too bad. No aftertaste, it just flows away.
Cant see what this has to do with Weizen... Strong bockbeer, roasty and caramel flavours are well represented. Full body, heavy on the alcohol. There is not much more to expect from a strong bock.

Pours a dark red beer with a good creamy tan head. Smells coffee, nuts and malts. Tastes caramel, coffee and licorice. Bit metalic in the aftertaste. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture. Very good bock beer.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2013 Doppelbock to bardziej stosowne określenie tego piwa, ponieważ pszenica gdzieś zagubiła się w tej potężnej słodowości. Aromat kawowo-czekoladowy, co dość zaskoczyło mnie, ponieważ to nie powinny być dominujące cechy piwa w tym stylu. W smaku treściwe, pełne, ale dość jednowymiarowe. Potężna słodowość skontrowana kawą przywoływała na myśl imperial stout. Goryczki praktycznie nie ma, piwo mimo mocy i wyraźnych nut alkoholowych "wchodzi" dość gładko. Warto spróbować, ponieważ piwo jest pełne niespodzianek, ale u mnie pozostawiło spory niedosyt.
chocolate, coffee, a bit roasty, a litle banana taste, red brown, full body, average carbonation, long finish,

Bought a bottle at SPAR in Vuren. The beer is dark brown with full tinted foam, CO2 level is very good. In the aroma nice tones of caramel and coffee. The taste is light bitter and refers to the coffee aroma, but also hints of pure chocolate and some dark fruits. The finish is very intense with a longish complex taste which is quiet bitter. A very good Bock from Holland, one of the best Ive tasted so far.
Poured a clear medium reddish brown with a small off white head. Aroma of roast malt, chocolate and liquorice. Medium body, flavour much as the aroma, some alcohol soaked raisin in it as well.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 New rating
Appearance: A dark chocolate brown with a good off cream coloured small head, which does not last long.
Nose : Faint,sweet malty, with burned malts
Taste- sweet caramelized malts,  milk chocolate, sweet dark fruits and alocohol dillution, hint of weizen sourness which saves this. But it does not feels as rich as past years.
thin-medium body, soft carbonation.

Quite different from what I remember. But less good, clearly. More a messy sweetness and odd body.


Old rating. (6/4/7/3/14=3.4)
33cl bottle

Appearance- Chocolate brown with a good off white head.
Nose sweet malty, with burned malts
Taste- sweet caramelized malts, with a hint of rye and milk chocolate and a hint of sweet dark fruits.
Alcohol adds some heavyness. Its a bit too sweet.
Full body, low carbonation.

On tap at the Bockbier Festival in Amsterdam. Pours a near clear dark brown with an earthy brown head that lasts throughout the beer and laces. Aroma has lots of leaves and grains with a hint of grass underlying. Flavor is similar with a grain and grass combination that is backed by leaves.
Donkere chocoladebruine kleur. Aardige schuimkraag. Zoetige moutgeur en iets gebrand. Smaakt vol. Smaakt iets koffie en gebrand.

from tap. 2012 and 2013 version at the same time. older version has a lot more chocolate and coffee flavour. but the carbonation was allmost gone. the new version has a lot more fruit, raisins, and grapes, and carbonation in the taste. one of the better bock beers from here

Bottle. Pours a murky dark brown beer with a small, light beige head on top. Aroma of chocolate, licorice, molasses and caramel. Flavour is sweet with big chocolate notes and some burning alcohol feelings. Some dark fruits in the flavor, overall quite sweet and malty. Alcohol is noticeable in mouthfeel and flavor. Short finish, full bodied, light carbo. Nice beer!
Draught at Arendsnest. Clear dark brown - white head. Dried fruits. Licorice. Sweetness. Candy sweetness. Dark sugars. Fruity. Not my style.

Pours black small white head , fades rather fast
Smells like sweet chocolate 
taste is very faded chocolate 
Something bitter 
Very low carbo

Draught at tArendsnest.
Black coloured with a medium sized off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of hay.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel and dried fruits with notes of spices.
Sweet and spicy finish.
Very dark with a nice beige head. Aroma is dark malts, some coffee, sweet. Taste is roasty, coffee caramel/toffee. Starts sweet ends light bitter/sweet.
Strong bock beer, partly brewed with wheat and some rye if Im not mistaken. Dutch bock beer is often sweet and boring, but this is one tasty beer.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014 Very dark beer, light brown foam. Taste of coffee and chocolate, nuts, then alcohol and a mildly bitter aftertaste. Enjoyable, but a little thin in tast.

Flaska från beernavigator, Kastanjefärgad, klar, lågt krämigtbeige skum. Stor maltig doft av choklad, muskovado, söta bakverk och deg. Stor maltsöt smak av russin, choklad, mörkt socker, knäck med mandel. Rejäl beska för stil gör avslutningen ganska stram. Riktigt trevlig.
A stronger and better version of the Jopen Bokbier. It has a complex flavor and a lasting aftertaste. Something very enjoyable.
Aroma: Caramel, hint of coffee, soy sauce? Appearance: Dark brown, beige head, minimum foam, fine lace Taste: Caramel, hint of coffee, light bitter finish, bit dry on the end, bit of dark fruits

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2013 Uit fles tijdens verkiezing lekkerste bockbier 2012. Erg donker bruin, tegen zwart aan, met prachtig licht bruin schuim, een goed begin. In de geur donkere mout tonen en koffie. In de smaak, Rogge en gebrande mout, ook hier weer de koffie en donkere chocolade. Ook een klein ondefinieerbaar zuurtje. Al met al een top bock, met een zeer goed afgestemd palet van smaken en een mooie bolle body.
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aromas of caramel, honey, hints of leather and roast; flavour starts sweet and progresses into long medium bitter finish, very nice
Nice malty coffee aroma. Must be like a double bock but I dont get The weisse. Nice sweet, bitter in taste too.

Bottle @ home. Quite a dark brown to black colour with a full light brown head. Smells quite a lot of coffee, roasty, some dark chocolate, dark malts, quite deep, slightly earthly and overall quite lovely. Tastes roasty, coffee, dark chocolate, dark malts and unfortunately something metallic. Full body, lovely carbo. Great brew.
Clear dark brown with light brown foam head, lacing. Aroma is weak, some caramel. Taste is caramel with some bitter notes. Aftertaste is turning more bitter in time. (Haarlem 201304)

Tap @ Jopenkerk, Lammetjesdag Haarlem. Very dark brown colour, tan head. Nose is caramel, chocolate, creamy, a bit buttery. Flavour is chocolate cream, chocolate, caramel, bit of vanilla. Great stuff!

Bottle 30 cl. Courtesy of Countbeer. Pours a dark brown with a reddish hue and a creamy and lacing light brown head. Roasty nose with some phenols showing also. Rich body, roasty, figgy, quite some chocolate and a whiff of metal.Some alcohol heat late. Quite nice - but is this really a Weizenbock? 260313

Bottle @ Home. Pours dark brown with a offwhite head. Aroma of roasted malt, wheat, sweets, dark fruits. Flavor is malts, wheat, yeast, chocolate, fruit. Thin to medium, lively carbonation, alcoholic finish. 230313

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear very dark brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel, roasted malt dark fruit and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish with notes of alcohol. 220313
Bottle, 9%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, yeast, little coffee with notes of alcohol.
Bottle. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are roast malt, licorice, caramel, coffee, fruits, nuts and hops.
Like a porter. Had rich coffee bitter and semi-pure-chocolaty flavors with a tad caramel sweetness. Its good, but not the best in this style.

300ml bottle. Hazy dark brown colour with smallt to average, firm, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, tan head. Toasty dark malty aroma, grainy background. Taste is initially moderately sweet toasty dark malty, later more spicy and yeasty, more and more bitter to the end, in the finish hints of chocolate, vestiges of alcohol. Not what I would expect a Weizenbock to taste like.

330 ml long neck bottle, poured into a weizen glass.

Very very dark brown colour, almost black, with a deep beige head, two fingers tall, creamy and with very good retention. Some light lacing around the glass. Impressive.
Lots of roasted malts on the nose, some light alcohol smell but not very noticeable at forst and some coffee aromas.
Amazing taste, again lots of roasted malts, coffee, toffees and chocolate, slighty bitter on the aftertaste. Very drinkable.
Average carbonation and a full body. The alcohol very nicely hidden.
Great beer and very drinkable.

Lots of malts, sweet but not too sweet, nice bitterness.

Draught at Arendsnest, AmsterdamThe color is almost black, with creamy head. The aroma is alcoholic and a bit boozy. The flavor is simple, some caramel and chocolate, with light oxidization, low bitterness.Simple beer.
Aroma wat zurig en licht rokerig met een licht zoetje. Smaak is kruidig, donkerzoet en chocolade met koffie. Van de tap@ de klep. Lichte koffie nasmaak.
Roasted malt with a spicy character, ginger, cinnamon, combined with almonds and chocolate. Bitter/sweet well balanced. Excellent beer.

Head: large, beige foam. Color: misty, ruby brown. Aroma: dark roasted malt coffee. Taste: roasted malt, medium bitterness. Palate: medium body, slick feel, lively carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: nice, but strong in alcohol which you dont notice right away.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Deep brown almost black with a huge tan head. Roasted malts, molasses and a hint of cherry bonbons in the aroma. Taste is bittersweet with the emphasis on bitter, with more roasted malts. Lively carbonation and an aftertaste with a hint of acholwarmth but the ABV is very well hidden. Great beer.

Draught @ Arendsnest. Dark Brown coloured. Light Brown fluffy head. Aroma: sweetness, light roast, bread. Flavour: sweetness, caramel, fruits. Roast, chocolate. Medium. Bodied. Ends light roasted bitter.
on draught. 2010 version. Presencia del alcohol en el aroma. Sabor a ciruelas pasas y regusto al alcohol.
Draft, 2010 version. Almost black, beige head. Aroma and taste of oddly spiced licorice. Interesting.

Bottled, shared with mowbeer. Pretty close to black with a thin beige head and purple highlights; aroma hinting at nut brittle and choc doughnuts; steady flavours with hints of stewed stone fruits and plenty of dry burnt bitterness which creeps up on you

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2012 Bottled bought at the Pivni Romonitos stall at the 2012 dysina beer fest. shared with motelpogo...Very dark purpley color,very pleasant aroma,chocolate eclair,thick chocolate syrup.Bubbly beige head,cappuccino,crispy cream doughnuts.Awesome beer...

Bottle from Bierkoning, many thanks! Very dark beer with a very small head and an interesting, roasty smell. It is sweet, desert-like, with licorice, raisins, caramel, roasted malt, a spicy yeastiness and walnuts, coupled with subtle notes of chocolate and almond or even marchpane. Wasnt expecting this to be so good. Solid body with a strong flavour dominated by dark and roasted malts. Light sweet with a light to medium, roasted bitterness. The finish is decidedly boozy but also classy, not leaping into ordinary astringency but letting the warming alcoholic fumes take over the back of the mouth. Very well balanced and very good, a beer for slow sipping.
The head is ok. It smells roasty. The taste is roasty, spicy, sweet-aromatic, malty, darkmalty, sweet, nice hoppy. In the aftertaste sweet-aromatic, hoppy and sour. Good! 11/12/11/12/-/12

Draft at Gollems Proeflokaal, Amsterdam on 16th March 2012. Brown-to-black with grey ring-and-film head and almost no lacing. Rich pungent aroma. Deeply pungent liquid with soft fruit/berries/blackcurrant cassis. Finish is leathery and a touch lactic with noticeable roof-of-mouth bitterness. Medium body and slightly oily yet grainy and engaging texture. An interesting beer.

(30 cl bottle) Reddish dark brown colour, almost black, with a tan foamy head. Light to medium bitter, medium sweet taste. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, nuts, dried fruits, and minerals. Pumpernickel. A hint of herbal hops in the background as a contrast as well. Medium to full body, slightly sticky texture. Alcoholic. To sweet and heavy for my taste right now, but certainly a good beer.

On tap at De Wildeman, Amsterdam, 02.03.12   Dark, dark brown in colour with a light beige head. There is a touch of spice on the nose, roasty with a little sourness, soft in the mouth with chocolate biscuit, good stuff.   A7 A4 T8 P3 Ov15  3.7

From tap at Wildeman. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is dark roasted malty, schwarzbrot and almost burned. Thick malty, alcohol, hardroasted malty and bitter. Rather tough dark hard roasted malty with a very dry and bitter finish.
Bottle shared at Jopenkerk.  Dark drown pour with bubbly tan head.  Aroma of malt, caramel and dark fruit.  Flavour matches aroma with some fudge in the finish. Nice beer

Dark brown colour; good creamy foam; roasted malts, licorice, fruit smell; sweet/fruity taste with nice bitterness; full body; very drinkable even at 9% alcohol. Great doppel bock (or extra stout) beer.

Tap @ Nederlands Biercafe t Arendsnest. Pours pitch black with a creamy tanned head leaving rich lacing. Aroma is acidy, smokey, fruity , some licorice and roasted malty. Flavor is sweet, slightly roasted, malty very fruity, bitter, bananas, phenolic and alcohol. Finishes malty, roasted and fruity.

Bottled 330ml (BZ, BB 09/2012)
Dark deep ruby color, small beige head. Nice bready-soy sauce malty, chocolaty aroma. Medium to full bodied. Caramelly, sweet, some soy sauce, bready, some fruity notes. More like doppelbock than weizen bock. Good stuff except aftertaste which has some plastic-like notes.

Bottle. [thanks skortila & caesar]
Deep opaque brown with a firm, creamy, staying, beige head. Good lacing. Aroma has chocolate, banana, prunes, light alcohol, soft roasted. Medium carbonation, soft creamy and a bit light mouthfeel. Flavour is great, almost chocolate-stout-ish. Chocolate, plums, raisins, cocoa, soft vinious. Lingering, mild, malty bitterness. A very nice Weizenbock.
Slightly smoky it seems. Nice beer, good bock. Not too sweet and a balanced palate. Warming, slight metallic aftertaste. From a bottle.
2011 - 11 - 07 330ml bottle. dark brown colour. medium creme head. roasty dark fruit in aroma. sweet taste. light bitter finish.
Donker roodbruin met stevige creme-kleurige kraag. Smaak zoet, overrijp fruit, kruiden. Goede dubbelbock.

I was not too impressed by the 2011 Jopen Johannieter bock. Not a bad beer but didnt fit in my perspective of Jopen beer, especially because of its lack of Jopen-characteristics. Just a decent, easy to like Bock.
Bottle @ home. Aroma is murky/dusty/swampy malt, spices, liquorice, faint metal. Flavour is deep and malty, some metal, faint spices. Caramel, liquorice etc.

Bottle from Bierzwerg. Poured dark brown with a lasting head, nice lacing. Aroma is very tempting, slightly sweet, roasted malt, chocolate and fruits. Flavor is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Long finish that is slightly sweet with hints of chocolate and some fruits. Some alcohol warmth in finish as well. Excellent!
Bottle at home. Dark brown colored beer. Smell roasted malts and some sweetness. Bit confusing, mixed taste; ok but not great. Good carbo and body.

33 cl bottle @ home. Dark brown color with beige head. Aromas of roasted malt, some caramel sweetness, sweet fruit, a hint of spices (coriander?). Flavor is roasted sweet (even though the label claims its not sweet). Soft carbonation. Not a strong alcoholfeel, except in the throat (warming). More roast and a light bitterness in the finish. Quite nice.
Fra flaske, dufter af rugbrød og cokolade... grumset sort med hvidt skum,smager sødt af rugbrød og chokolade, let fylde af chokolade...... en ok øl

(bottle, 33cl) Cloudy, dark brown colour with a beige medium-sized foamy head. Roasted malty aroma with loads of caramel, coffee and dark chocolate, accompanied by dark fruits and traces of alcohol. Sweet flavour with a light bitterness, full bodied with a moderate carbonation. Dark and roasted malt-character with dark and dried fruits, a tinge of chocolate and mocha; moderately sweet and roasted bitter finish with coffee, dark chocolate and alcoholic notes in the aftertaste. Pretty good. 09.IV.11
Bottle , 75 cl.Drak brown, dense creme head.Aroma has roasted malts, caramel, coffee, some herbs. smooth taste, full bodied, some bitterness, with coffee, mocca. NIce one.

On tap at the alkmaar beer festival.
Dark brown colour. Nice aftertaste. Yummy
Botella. Black colour, big off-white head, nice. Roasted malt, caramel, bit smokish aroma. Good mouthfeel. Roasty malty fruity sweetish flavour with a bit smoke and chcolate. Yum.

dark brown, smooth light brown head.
aroma is roasted stuff, spicy hoppy balance.
flavor is licorice, roasted stuff, well balanced..

Bottle. Trade by Borresteijn. Thanks Rob!! This pours dark brown with a creamy light tan head. The aroma is light smoked, sweet caramel, light banana and sweet spicy. The flavour is sweet malty, sweet caramel, banana and sweet tobacco. Light smokey notes. Long sweet fruity finish!
Bottle at Pint Winterbierf estival, Gouda: Dark brown brew with an taste of roasted malts, dried fruits  and chocolate. This can become an possible classic or legend.

Bottle at home. Dark brown pour, foamy tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, licorice, banana and some tobacco. Flavor is quite sweet and fruity, but also bitter and roasted. Nice balance between the bitter roasted malts and the fruity wheat and yeast. Thick body. Nice brew.
33cl, as Johannieter, new Dutch brew Anno 2010, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex brew, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew

Bottle:
Big loose light brown foamy head on top of a deep dark brown to black beer.
Smell roasted malts, caramel, dark spices and fruit, pepper cinnamon, prunes and light smokey.
Taste is a delicious mix of liquorice, coffee, grass, toasted malts, caramel. Soft carbo to none and a soft mouthfeel.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottled. Dark color, medium brown head. Aroma of roasted malt, licorice, hint of caramel, slight spicy. Quite sweet (although the bottle says it shouldnt be), moderate bitter. Licorice (drop, not salmiak) is the main feeling I get.

tap at in de wildeman...pours a dark cola caramel brown with a thin off-white head... roastiness, dark fruit, and chocolate in the aroma... flavors are sweet with dark fruit, a light roast, chocolate with a light to medium body. not a bad brew at all by any means.  would drink this again.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Nice dark brown body with medium, gushing head. Nose of malts, caramel and dark fruits. Taste of malts, toffee, sweet and quite roasty. A very enjoyable ale, very Bock-like.Earlier Rating: 3/28/2010 Total Score: 3.5On tap at Wildeman. Dark brown with no head. Beautiful nose of chocolate and cheeses. Taste of smoked and dark malts. Chocolate notes. Very smooth. Finish tasted like vanilla ice cream. Very pleasant Jopen production.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2010 Found @ Mitra Hengelo. Corked bottle. Deep dark brown color. Caramel, chocolate and speculaas in the aroma. Full bodied. malty sweet roasty flavor with hints of ash, caramel, milk chocolate. tasty, Well rounded beer



Tap @ In de Wildeman, as Jopen Weizen Starkbock. Deep dark brown color. Opague. Malty, slightly toasted aroma with cookies. Loads of malt in the flavor, slightly roasted and nutty. Chocolate cake and caramel. Full bodied.  8 4 8 3 15 = 3.8

Tap at In de Wildeman with Edo.  Pours a very dark brownish almost black with a medium beige soda head which fades a bit.  Aroma is very rich nutty dark chocolate, licorice, spicebox, cedar, roast coffee beans, porterish - lots of chocolate malt, a bit acrid and burnt as well- with medium phenols and on the lighter side with the fruity esters.  Flavor is more tobacco, licorice, dark charred malts, burnt notes, roasted barley, thick oily chocolate, spice, rubber, phenolic, and a bit harsh in the end.  Interesting and pretty good overall, though it doesnt really come too close in the yeast profile to most weizenbocks.

Nearly black with a medium beige head. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, dark fruits, toffee and chocolate. Quite sweet flavour with roasted malt, toffee, caramel dark sweet fruits and and dark chocolate. Very sweet. Could have used some hops.

Draught @ Nederlands Biercafe t Arendsnest, Herengracht 90, Amsterdam, Netherlands.Clear medium to dark brown color with a average to large, creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, coffee, dark berry - raisin, brown sugar, chocolate notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, alcohol. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20091210]

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2010 As Dubbel Bok or Weizen Starkbok: On tap at t Arendsnest. Opaque dark brown to black colour, light beige head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, dark fruits, molasses. Flavour is light sweet, lots of hard roasted malts, bitter chocolate, some dark fruits, burnt sugar, roasted bitter finish. Medium bodied. Good, solid and tasty strong bock. 747315 Update: as Johannieter: Same aroma and flavour profile, just a bit more chocolate and a bit more sweetness. Very tasty. 848315

Tap @ Bockbierfestival 2009. A black colored beer with a beige head. The aroma of chocolate malt with hints of fruit. The tatste is chocolate sweet with fruits like raisins. The aftertaste of chocolate and some bitter with sweets.

Tap (PINT BBF 09): Deep amber, almost black coloured, small lacy beige foam; sweet toaste malt and restrained molasses in the nose; solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium to full bodied; sweet caramelly finish. Could be a bit hoppier........
